com.netflix.spectator.nflx

Class RxHttp

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.spectator.nflx.RxHttp

  • public final class RxHttp
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper for some simple uses of rxnetty with eureka. Only intended for use within the spectator plugin.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  RxHttp.Server
      Represents a server to try and connect to.

      • submit

        public static rx.Observable<io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientResponse<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>> submit(io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientRequest<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> req)
        Submit an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        req - Request to execute. Note the content should be passed in separately not already passed to the request. The RxNetty request object doesn't provide a way to get the content out via the public api, so we need to keep it separate in case a new request object must be created.
        Returns:
        Observable with the response of the request.

      • submit

        public static rx.Observable<io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientResponse<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>> submit(io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientRequest<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> req,
                                                                                                                        java.lang.String entity)
        Submit an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        req - Request to execute. Note the content should be passed in separately not already passed to the request. The RxNetty request object doesn't provide a way to get the content out via the public api, so we need to keep it separate in case a new request object must be created.
        entity - Content data or null if no content is needed for the request body.
        Returns:
        Observable with the response of the request.

      • submit

        public static rx.Observable<io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientResponse<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf>> submit(io.reactivex.netty.protocol.http.client.HttpClientRequest<io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf> req,
                                                                                                                        byte[] entity)
        Submit an HTTP request.
        Parameters:
        req - Request to execute. Note the content should be passed in separately not already passed to the request. The RxNetty request object doesn't provide a way to get the content out via the public api, so we need to keep it separate in case a new request object must be created.
        entity - Content data or null if no content is needed for the request body.
        Returns:
        Observable with the response of the request.
